optcom.components package¶

Submodules¶

optcom.components.abstract_component module¶

class optcom.components.abstract_component.AbstractComponent(name, default_name, ports_type, save, wait=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: object

Parent of any component object. Represent a node of the layout graph.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • default_name -- The default name of the component.

  • ports_type -- Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

  • save -- If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

  • wait -- If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

  • max_nbr_pass -- If not None, no fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

add_port_policy(*policy)¶

Append a new policy to automatically designate output port depending on the input port.

Parameters

policy -- The policy (a, b, flag) assigns input ports in list a to output ports in list b. If flag is True, also assign input ports of b to output ports of a. If there is -1 in list b, the field entering at the corresponding port in list a will not be transmitted. N.B.: if (len(a) < len(b)), pad a with length of b. len(a) must be >= len(b)

add_wait_policy(*policy)¶

Append a new policy to automatically make a port waiting for other port(s).

Parameters

policy -- The number(s) in the list correspond to the port number(s) which have to wait for each others.

classmethod dec_nbr_instances()¶
classmethod dec_nbr_instances_with_default_name()¶
del_port_id(port_id)¶

output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports -- The inputs ports.

Returns

The output ports.

optcom.components.abstract_fiber_amp module¶

class optcom.components.abstract_fiber_amp.AbstractFiberAmp(name, default_name, save, max_nbr_pass, pre_call_code, post_call_code, REFL_SEED, REFL_PUMP, PROP_PUMP, PROP_REFL, BISEED, BIPUMP)¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

A non ideal Fiber Amplifier.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

REFL_SEED¶

If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

Type

bool

REFL_PUMP¶

If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

Type

bool

PROP_PUMP¶

If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

Type

bool

PROP_REFL¶

If True, the relfected fields are propagated in the layout as new fields.

Type

bool

BISEED¶

If True, waiting policy waits for seed at both ends.

Type

bool

BIPUMP¶

If True, waiting policy waits for pump at both ends.

Type

bool

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] _____________________ [1]
    /                   \
   /                     \
[2]                       [3]

[0] and [1] : signal and [2] and [3] : pump

Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • default_name -- The default name of the amplifier.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

  • REFL_SEED (bool) -- If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

  • REFL_PUMP (bool) -- If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

  • PROP_PUMP -- If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

  • PROP_REFL -- If True, the relfected fields are propagated in the layout as new fields.

  • BISEED -- If True, waiting policy waits for seed at both ends.

  • BIPUMP -- If True, waiting policy waits for pump at both ends.

property BIPUMP¶
property BISEED¶
property PROP_PUMP¶
output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports -- The inputs ports.

Returns

The output ports.

set_port_policy()¶
set_wait_policy()¶

optcom.components.abstract_fiber_amp_2levels module¶

class optcom.components.abstract_fiber_amp_2levels.AbstractFiberAmp2Levels(name, default_name, length, alpha, alpha_order, beta, beta_order, gain_order, gamma, sigma, eta, T_R, h_R, f_R, n_core, n_clad, NA, v_nbr, eff_area, nl_index, overlap, sigma_a, sigma_e, en_sat, doped_area, tau, N_T, core_radius, clad_radius, R_0, R_L, medium_core, medium_clad, temperature, nl_approx, RESO_INDEX, CORE_PUMPED, CLAD_PUMPED, ATT, DISP, SPM, XPM, FWM, SS, RS, XNL, GAIN_SAT, NOISE, approx_type, split_noise_option, noise_ode_method, UNI_OMEGA, STEP_UPDATE, INTRA_COMP_DELAY, INTRA_PORT_DELAY, INTER_PORT_DELAY, REFL_SEED, REFL_PUMP, PRE_PUMP_PROP, nlse_method, step_method, steps, max_nbr_iter, error, PROP_PUMP, PROP_REFL, BISEED, BIPUMP, save, save_all, max_nbr_pass, pre_call_code, post_call_code)¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_fiber_amp.AbstractFiberAmp

A non ideal Fiber Amplifier with 2-levels rate equations.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

REFL_SEED¶

If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

Type

bool

REFL_PUMP¶

If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

Type

bool

PROP_PUMP¶

If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

Type

bool

PROP_REFL¶

If True, the relfected fields are propagated in the layout as new fields.

Type

bool

BISEED¶

If True, waiting policy waits for seed at both ends.

Type

bool

BIPUMP¶

If True, waiting policy waits for pump at both ends.

Type

bool

population_levels¶

The population density of each level. \([nm^{-3}]\)

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] _____________________ [1]
    /                   \
   /                     \
[2]                       [3]

[0] and [1] : signal and [2] and [3] : pump

Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • length -- The length of the fiber. \([km]\)

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(nl_index)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factor. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(overlap)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\) If None, will be set to the core area.

  • tau -- The lifetime of the metastable level. \([\mu s]\)

  • N_T -- The total doping concentration. \([nm^{-3}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • nl_approx -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • RESO_INDEX -- If True, trigger the resonant refractive index which will be added to the core refractive index. To see the effect of the resonant index, the flag STEP_UPDATE must be set to True in order to update the dispersion coefficient at each space step depending on the resonant index at each space step.

  • CORE_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the core.

  • CLAD_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the cladding.

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SS -- If True, trigger the self-steepening. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • noise_ode_method -- The ode solver method type for noise propagation computation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • REFL_SEED -- If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

  • REFL_PUMP -- If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

  • PRE_PUMP_PROP -- If True, propagate only the pump the first iteration and then add the seed at the second iteration. Otherwise, consider both pump and seed simultaneously. Results will be consistent but setting this flag to True can have a significant impact on the convergence speed. Without knowledge of the algorithm, it is adviced to let it to False.

  • nlse_method -- The nlse solver method type.

  • step_method -- The method for spatial step size generation.

  • steps -- The number of steps for the solver

  • max_nbr_iter -- The maximum number of iterations if shooting method is employed.

  • error -- The error for convergence criterion of stepper resolution.

  • PROP_PUMP -- If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

  • PROP_REFL -- If True, the relfected fields are propagated in the layout as new fields.

  • BISEED -- If True, waiting policy waits for seed at both ends.

  • BIPUMP -- If True, waiting policy waits for pump at both ends.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

optcom.components.cw module¶

class optcom.components.cw.CW(name='CW', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], peak_power=[0.001], energy=[], offset_nu=[0.0], init_phi=[0.0], field_name='', save=False, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_start_comp.AbstractStartComp

A CW pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

peak_power¶

Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

Type

list of float

energy¶

Total power of the pulses. \([J]\) (peak_power will be ignored if energy provided)

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

field_name¶

The name of the field.

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \exp\Big[i\big(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c +\nu_{offset})t\big)\Big]\]

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • channels -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • peak_power -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • energy -- Total power of the pulses. \([J]\) (peak_power will be ignored if energy provided)

  • offset_nu -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • init_phi -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • field_name -- The name of the field.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

optcom.components.fiber module¶

class optcom.components.fiber.Fiber(name='Fiber', length=1.0, alpha=None, alpha_order=0, beta=None, beta_order=2, gamma=None, sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, h_R=None, f_R=0.245, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, n_core=None, n_clad=None, NA=None, v_nbr=None, eff_area=None, nl_index=None, nl_approx=True, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, XNL=False, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, noise_ode_method='rk4', UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False, nlse_method='rk4ip', step_method='fixed', steps=100, save=False, save_all=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

A non ideal Fiber.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] __________________ [1]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • length -- The length of the fiber. \([km]\)

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_approx -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • noise_ode_method -- The ode solver method type for noise propagation computation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • nlse_method -- The nlse solver method type.

  • step_method -- The method for spatial step size generation.

  • steps -- The number of steps for the solver

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

class optcom.components.fiber_coupler.FiberCoupler(name='Fiber Coupler', length=1.0, nbr_fibers=2, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gamma=[None], kappa=[[None]], sigma=[2.0], sigma_cross=[[0.0]], eta=[2.0], eta_cross=[[0.0]], T_R=[0.003], h_R=[None], f_R=0.245, core_radius=[5.0], clad_radius=62.5, c2c_spacing=[[15.0]], n_core=[None], n_clad=None, NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], nl_approx=True, medium_core=['sio2'], medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, ATT=True, DISP=True, SPM=True, XPM=False, FWM=False, SS=False, RS=False, XNL=False, ASYM=True, COUP=True, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, noise_ode_method='rk4', UNI_OMEGA=True, STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False, nlse_method='rk4ip', ode_method='euler', step_method='fixed', steps=100, save=False, save_all=False, wait=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] _______        ______ [2]
           \______/
[1] _______/      \______ [3]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • length -- The length of the coupler. \([km]\)

  • nbr_fibers -- The number of fibers in the coupler.

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • kappa -- The coupling coefficients. \([km^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • sigma_cross -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • eta_cross -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE inbetween the fibers.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • core_radius -- The core radius. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • c2c_spacing -- The center to center distance between two cores. \([\mu m]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the clading. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nl_approx -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • medium_core -- The medium of the fiber core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the fiber cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing.

  • SS (bool) -- If True, trigger the self-steepening.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects.

  • ASYM -- If True, trigger the asymmetry effects between cores.

  • COUP -- If True, trigger the coupling effects between cores.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • noise_ode_method -- The ode solver method type for noise propagation computation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • nlse_method -- The nlse solver method type.

  • ode_method -- The ode solver method type.

  • step_method -- The method for spatial step size generation.

  • steps -- The number of steps for the solver

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

  • wait -- If True, wait for another pulse in the anolog port [0 <-> 1, and 2 <-> 3] to launch the simulation.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports -- The inputs ports.

Returns

The output ports.

optcom.components.fiber_yb module¶

class optcom.components.fiber_yb.FiberYb(name='Ytterbium Fiber', length=1.0, alpha=[None], alpha_order=0, beta=[None], beta_order=2, gain_order=0, gamma=[None], sigma=2.0, eta=2.0, T_R=0.003, h_R=None, f_R=0.245, n_core=[None], n_clad=[None], NA=[None], v_nbr=[None], eff_area=[None], nl_index=[None], overlap=[None], sigma_a=[None], sigma_e=[None], en_sat=[None], doped_area=None, tau=840.0, N_T=0.063, core_radius=5.0, clad_radius=12.5, R_0=0.0008, R_L=0.0008, medium_core='sio2', medium_clad='sio2', temperature=293.1, nl_approx=True, RESO_INDEX=True, CORE_PUMPED=True, CLAD_PUMPED=False, ATT=[True, True], DISP=[True, False], SPM=[True, False], XPM=[False, False], FWM=[False, False], SS=[False, False], RS=[False, False], XNL=[False, False], GAIN_SAT=True, NOISE=True, approx_type=1, split_noise_option='seed_split', noise_ode_method='rk4', UNI_OMEGA=[True, True], STEP_UPDATE=False, INTRA_COMP_DELAY=True, INTRA_PORT_DELAY=True, INTER_PORT_DELAY=False, REFL_SEED=False, REFL_PUMP=True, PRE_PUMP_PROP=False, nlse_method='rk4ip', step_method='fixed', steps=100, max_nbr_iter=100, error=0.01, PROP_PUMP=False, PROP_REFL=False, BISEED=False, BIPUMP=False, save=False, save_all=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

[0] _____________________ [1]
    /                   \
   /                     \
[2]                       [3]

[0] and [1] : signal and [2] and [3] : pump

Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • length -- The length of the fiber. \([km]\)

  • alpha -- The derivatives of the attenuation coefficients. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • alpha_order -- The order of alpha coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if alpha values are provided - no file)

  • beta -- The derivatives of the propagation constant. \([km^{-1}, ps\cdot km^{-1}, ps^2\cdot km^{-1}, ps^3\cdot km^{-1}, \ldots]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • beta_order -- The order of beta coefficients to take into account. (will be ignored if beta values are provided - no file)

  • gain_order -- The order of the gain coefficients to take into account.

  • gamma -- The non linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • sigma -- Positive term multiplying the XPM terms of the NLSE.

  • eta -- Positive term multiplying the cross-non-linear terms of the NLSE.

  • T_R -- The raman coefficient. \([]\)

  • h_R -- The Raman response function values. If a callable is provided, variable must be time. \([ps]\)

  • f_R -- The fractional contribution of the delayed Raman response. \([]\)

  • n_core -- The refractive index of the core. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_core)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • n_clad -- The refractive index of the cladding. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(n_clad)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • NA -- The numerical aperture. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(NA)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • v_nbr -- The V number. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(v_nbr)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • eff_area -- The effective area. \([\u m^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(eff_area)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • nl_index -- The non-linear coefficient. \([m^2\cdot W^{-1}]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(nl_index)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • overlap -- The overlap factor. \([]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(overlap)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_a -- The absorption cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_a)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • sigma_e -- The emission cross sections. \([nm^2]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(sigma_e)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • en_sat -- The saturation energy. \([J]\) If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\) (1<=len(en_sat)<=2 for signal and pump)

  • doped_area -- The doped area. \([\mu m^2]\) If None, will be set to the core area.

  • tau -- The lifetime of the metastable level. \([\mu s]\)

  • N_T -- The total doping concentration. \([nm^{-3}]\)

  • core_radius -- The radius of the core. \([\mu m]\)

  • clad_radius -- The radius of the cladding. \([\mu m]\)

  • R_0 -- The reflectivity at the fiber start. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • R_L -- The reflectivity at the fiber end. If a callable is provided, variable must be angular frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • medium_core -- The medium of the core.

  • medium_clad -- The medium of the cladding.

  • temperature -- The temperature of the fiber. \([K]\)

  • nl_approx -- If True, the approximation of the NLSE is used.

  • RESO_INDEX -- If True, trigger the resonant refractive index which will be added to the core refractive index. To see the effect of the resonant index, the flag STEP_UPDATE must be set to True in order to update the dispersion coefficient at each space step depending on the resonant index at each space step.

  • CORE_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the core.

  • CLAD_PUMPED -- If True, there is dopant in the cladding.

  • ATT -- If True, trigger the attenuation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • DISP -- If True, trigger the dispersion. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SPM -- If True, trigger the self-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XPM -- If True, trigger the cross-phase modulation. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • FWM -- If True, trigger the Four-Wave mixing. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • SS -- If True, trigger the self-steepening. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • RS -- If True, trigger the Raman scattering. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • XNL -- If True, trigger cross-non linear effects. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • GAIN_SAT -- If True, trigger the gain saturation.

  • NOISE -- If True, trigger the noise calculation.

  • approx_type -- The type of the NLSE approximation.

  • split_noise_option -- The way the spontaneous emission power is split among the fields.

  • noise_ode_method -- The ode solver method type for noise propagation computation.

  • UNI_OMEGA -- If True, consider only the center omega for computation. Otherwise, considered omega discretization. The first element is related to the seed and the second to the pump.

  • STEP_UPDATE -- If True, update fiber parameters at each spatial sub-step.

  • INTRA_COMP_DELAY -- If True, take into account the relative time difference, between all waves, that is acquired while propagating in the component.

  • INTRA_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields but for each port.

  • INTER_PORT_DELAY -- If True, take into account the initial relative time difference between channels of all fields of all ports.

  • REFL_SEED -- If True, take into account the reflected seed waves for computation.

  • REFL_PUMP -- If True, take into account the reflected pump waves for computation.

  • PRE_PUMP_PROP -- If True, propagate only the pump the first iteration and then add the seed at the second iteration. Otherwise, consider both pump and seed simultaneously. Results will be consistent but setting this flag to True can have a significant impact on the convergence speed. Without knowledge of the algorithm, it is adviced to let it to False.

  • nlse_method -- The nlse solver method type.

  • step_method -- The method for spatial step size generation.

  • steps -- The number of steps for the solver

  • max_nbr_iter -- The maximum number of iterations if shooting method is employed.

  • error -- The error for convergence criterion of stepper resolution.

  • PROP_PUMP -- If True, the pump is propagated forward in the layout.

  • PROP_REFL -- If True, the relfected fields are propagated in the layout as new fields.

  • BISEED -- If True, waiting policy waits for seed at both ends.

  • BIPUMP -- If True, waiting policy waits for pump at both ends.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • save_all -- If True, save the wave at each spatial step in the component.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \exp\bigg[-\frac{1+iC}{2} \bigg(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\bigg)^{2m} + i\big(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c + \nu_{offset})t\big)\bigg]\]

where \(T_0\) is the half width at \(1/e\)-intensity.

  • channels -- The number of channels in the field.

  • position -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • fwhm -- Full band width at half maximum. \([ps]\) If fwhm is provided, the width will be ignored. If fwhm is not provided or set to None, will use the width.

  • peak_power -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • rep_freq -- The repetition frequency of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • order -- The order of the super gaussian pulse.

  • chirp -- The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

  • init_phi -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • noise -- The initial noise along the pulses.

[0] __________________ [1]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • nu_bw -- The frequency spectral bandwidth. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • nu_offset -- The offset frequency. \([ps^{-1}]\)

  • order -- The order of the gaussian filter.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

optcom.components.ideal_combiner module¶

class optcom.components.ideal_combiner.IdealCombiner(name='Ideal Combiner', arms=2, combine=False, ratios=[], wait=True, save=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

An ideal Combiner.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

arms¶

The number of input arms.

Type

int

combine¶

If False, propagate all incoming fields in the last port. Otherwise, add common channels and append the others to create one single field. Both methods operate depending on ratios provided.

ratios¶

A list of ratios where each index is related to one arm. The length of the list should be equal to the number of arms, if not it will be pad to it. The ratio represents the fraction of the power that will be taken from the field arriving at the corresponding arm.

Notes

Component diagram:

[0]   _________
[1]   __________\
[2]   ___________\_______ [n]
[3]   ___________/
    ...
[n-1] _________/
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • arms -- The number of input arms.

  • combine -- If False, propagate all incoming fields in the last port. Otherwise, add common channels and append the others to create one single field. Both methods operate depending on ratios provided.

  • ratios -- A list of ratios where each index is related to one arm. The length of the list should be equal to the number of arms, if not it will be pad to it. The ratio represents the fraction of the power that will be taken from the field arriving at the corresponding arm.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

port_ratios¶

optcom.components.ideal_divider module¶

class optcom.components.ideal_divider.IdealDivider(name='Ideal Divider', arms=2, divide=True, ratios=[], save=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

An ideal Divider.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

arms¶

The number of input arms.

Type

int

divide¶

If False, propagate a copy of entering fields to each output port. (ratios will be ignored) Otherwise, divide power depending on provided ratios.

Type

bool

ratios¶

A list of ratios where each index is related to one arm. The length of the list should be equal to the number of arms, if not it will be pad to it. The ratio represents the fraction of the power that will be taken from the field arriving at the corresponding arm. If None is provided and divide is set to True, dispatch equally among arms.

Notes

Component diagram:

           __________ [1]
         /___________ [2]
[0] ____/____________ [3]
        \____________ [4]
         ...
         \___________ [n]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • arms -- The number of input arms.

  • divide -- If False, propagate a copy of entering fields to each output port. (ratios will be ignored) Otherwise, divide power depending on provided ratios.

  • ratios -- A list of ratios where each index is related to one arm. The length of the list should be equal to the number of arms, if not it will be pad to it. The ratio represents the fraction of the power that will be taken from the field arriving at the corresponding arm. If None is provided and divide is set to True, dispatch equally among arms.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports -- The inputs ports.

Returns

The output ports.

optcom.components.ideal_mzm module¶

class optcom.components.ideal_mzm.IdealMZM(name='Ideal MZ Modulator', phase_shift=[0.0, 0.0], loss=0.0, extinction=None, v_pi=None, v_bias=None, v_mod=None, save=False, max_nbr_pass=None, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

An ideal Mach Zehnder Modulator

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

phase_shift¶

The phase difference induced between the two arms of the MZ. Can be a list of callable with time variable. \([ps]\) (will be ignored if (v_pi and v_bias) or (v_pi and v_mod) are provided)

loss¶

The loss induced by the MZ. \([dB]\)

extinction¶

The extinction ratio. \([dB]\)

v_pi¶

The half-wave voltage. \([V]\)

v_bias¶

The bias voltage. \([V]\)

v_mod¶

The modulation voltage \([V]\). Must be a callable with time variable. \([ps]\)

Notes

\[\phi_k(t)= \pi \frac{V_{mod,k}(t)+V_{bias,k}}{V_{\pi,k}} \quad k\in\{1,2\}\]

Component diagram:

          _______
[0] _____/       \______ [1]
         \_______/
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • phase_shift -- The phase difference induced between the two arms of the MZ. Can be a list of callable with time variable. \([ps]\) (will be ignored if (v_pi and v_bias) or (v_pi and v_mod) are provided)

  • loss -- The loss induced by the MZ. \([dB]\)

  • extinction -- The extinction ratio. \([dB]\)

  • v_pi -- The half-wave voltage. \([V]\)

  • v_bias -- The bias voltage. \([V]\)

  • v_mod -- The modulation voltage \([V]\). Must be a callable with time variable. \([ps]\)

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • max_nbr_pass -- No fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

class optcom.components.load_field_from_file.LoadFieldFromFile(name='Field File Loader', file_name='saved_fields', list_index_to_load=[], raise_type_error=True, root_dir='.', save=False, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_start_comp.AbstractStartComp

This component allows one to load fields from a file which contains list of Field objects as a file line.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

file_name¶

The name of the file in which the fields are saved.

Type

str

list_index_to_load¶

The indices of the fields from the loaded Field list to propagate. If the index is out of range, this index is ignore. If the list is empty, will propagate all fields.

raise_type_error¶

If True, raise an error if the type of the loaded object from file is not a list of Field. If False, ignore the object.

Notes

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • file_name -- The name of the file in which the fields are saved. If no extension is provided, the default file extension will be considered. See config for default extension.

  • list_index_to_load -- The indices of the fields from the loaded Field list to propagate. If the index is out of range, this index is ignore. If the list is empty, will propagate all fields.

  • raise_type_error -- If True, raise an error if the type of the loaded object from file is not a list of Field. If False, ignore the object.

  • root_dir -- The root directory where to save the fields.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

optcom.components.port module¶

class optcom.components.port.Port(comp, type, max_nbr_pass=999)¶

Bases: object

Represent a port of a component. Components are linked via ports. The purpose of Port is not only link management, but can also be used to save fields.

comp¶

The component to which the port belongs.

comp_port_id¶

The ID of the port for the component comp.

Type

int

type¶

The type of the port. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

int

ngbr¶

The component to which the port is connected.

ngbr_port_id¶

The ID of the port for the component ngbr_comp.

Type

int

Parameters

  • comp -- The component to which the port belongs.

  • type -- The type of the port. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

  • max_nbr_pass -- The maximum number of pass allowed through this port.

property channels¶

Return a list of all channels arrays of all fields.

property comp_port_id¶
property counter_pass¶
dec_counter_pass()¶
property field¶

Return the last saved field if exists, otherwise None.

optcom.components.save_field_to_file module¶

class optcom.components.save_field_to_file.SaveFieldToFile(name='Field File Saver', file_name='saved_fields', add_fields=True, root_dir='.', save=False, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_pass_comp.AbstractPassComp

This component allows one to save one or multiple field(s) into a file. Dump all simultaneous incoming fields to a list of fields as a new line in a pk1 file.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

file_name¶

The name of the file in which the fields are saved.

Type

str

add_fields¶

If True and the file_name provided exists, add fields if fields already in file_name.

Notes

Component diagram:

[0] __________________
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • file_name -- The name of the file in which the fields are saved. If no extension is provided, the default file extension will be considered. See config for default extension.

  • add_fields -- If True and the file_name provided exists, add fields if fields already in file_name.

  • root_dir -- The root directory where to save the fields.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

property file_name¶
output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports -- The inputs ports.

Returns

The output ports.

property root_dir¶

optcom.components.sech module¶

class optcom.components.sech.Sech(name='Sech', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], position=[0.5], width=[10.0], fwhm=None, peak_power=[0.001], rep_freq=[0.0], offset_nu=[0.0], chirp=[0.0], init_phi=[0.0], noise=None, field_name='', save=False, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_start_comp.AbstractStartComp

An hyperbolic secant pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

position¶

Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

Type

list of float

width¶

Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

Type

list of float

fwhm¶

Full band width at half maximum. \([ps]\) If fwhm is provided, the width will be ignored. If fwhm is not provided or set to None, will use the width.

Type

list of float, optional

peak_power¶

Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

Type

list of float

rep_freq¶

The repetition frequency of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

chirp¶

The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

noise¶

The initial noise along the pulses.

Type

np.ndarray

Notes

\[A(0,t) = \sqrt{P_0} \,\text{sech}\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0} \Big)\exp\bigg[-\frac{iC}{2} \bigg(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\bigg)^{2} + i(\phi_0 - 2\pi (\nu_c + \nu_{offset})t)\bigg]\]

where \(T_0\) is the half width at \(1/e\)-intensity.

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • channels -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • position -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • fwhm -- Full band width at half maximum. \([ps]\) If fwhm is provided, the width will be ignored. If fwhm is not provided or set to None, will use the width.

  • peak_power -- Peak power of the pulses. \([W]\)

  • rep_freq -- The repetition frequency of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • offset_nu -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • chirp -- The chirp parameter for chirped pulses.

  • init_phi -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • noise -- The initial noise along the pulses.

  • field_name -- The name of the field.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

optcom.components.soliton module¶

class optcom.components.soliton.Soliton(name='Soliton', channels=1, center_lambda=[1552.0], position=[0.5], width=[10.0], fwhm=None, rep_freq=[0.0], offset_nu=[0.0], order=[1], init_phi=[0.0], noise=None, beta_2=[- 18.0], gamma=[1.0], field_name='', save=False, pre_call_code='', post_call_code='')¶

Bases: optcom.components.abstract_start_comp.AbstractStartComp

A soliton pulse Generator.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

call_counter¶

Count the number of times the function __call__() of the Component has been called.

Type

int

wait¶

If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

pre_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

post_call_code¶

A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.

channels¶

The number of channels in the field.

Type

int

center_lambda¶

The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

Type

list of float

position¶

Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

Type

list of float

width¶

Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

Type

list of float

fwhm¶

Full band width at half maximum. \([ps]\) If fwhm is provided, the width will be ignored. If fwhm is not provided or set to None, will use the width.

Type

list of float, optional

rep_freq¶

The repetition frequency of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

offset_nu¶

The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

Type

list of float

order¶

The order of the super soliton pulse.

Type

list of int

beta_2¶

The GVD term of the dispersion. (must be negative) \([ps^2\cdot km^{-1}]\)

Type

list of float

gamma¶

The non-linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\)

Type

list of float

init_phi¶

The nitial phase of the pulses.

Type

list of float

noise¶

The initial noise along the pulses.

Type

np.ndarray

Notes

\[\begin{split}\begin{split} A(0,t) &= \sqrt{P_0}\,\text{sech}\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0} \Big)\exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c +\nu_{offset})t)\bigg]\\ &= \sqrt{\frac{N_s^2}{\gamma L_D}} \,\text{sech}\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c+\nu_{offset})t) \bigg]\\ &= \sqrt{-\frac{N_s^2 \beta_2}{\gamma T_0^2}} \,\text{sech}\Big(\frac{t-t_0}{T_0}\Big) \exp\bigg[i(\phi_0-2\pi(\nu_c+\nu_{offset})t) \bigg] \end{split}\end{split}\]

where \(T_0\) is the half width at \(1/e\)-intensity.

Component diagram:

__________________ [0]
Parameters

  • name -- The name of the component.

  • channels -- The number of channels in the field.

  • center_lambda -- The center wavelength of the channels. \([nm]\)

  • position -- Relative position of the pulses in the time window. \(\in [0,1]\)

  • width -- Half width of the pulse. \([ps]\)

  • fwhm -- Full band width at half maximum. \([ps]\) If fwhm is provided, the width will be ignored. If fwhm is not provided or set to None, will use the width.

  • rep_freq -- The repetition frequency of the pulse in the time window. \([THz]\)

  • offset_nu -- The offset frequency. \([THz]\)

  • order -- The order of the super soliton pulse.

  • init_phi -- The initial phase of the pulses.

  • noise -- The initial noise along the pulses.

  • beta_2 -- The GVD term of the dispersion. (must be negative) \([ps^2\cdot km^{-1}]\)

  • gamma -- The non-linear coefficient. \([rad\cdot W^{-1}\cdot km^{-1}]\)

  • field_name -- The name of the field.

  • save -- If True, the last wave to enter/exit a port will be saved.

  • pre_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed prior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters input_ports and input_fields are available.

  • post_call_code -- A string containing code which will be executed posterior to the call to the function __call__(). The two parameters output_ports and output_fields are available.
